item.title: Replay of procedural experience is independent of the hippocampus
item.description: We use an unsupervised sequence detection algorithm to demonstrate, for the first time, replay of procedural memories in the striatum and that this replay is hippocampus-independent.

item.title: A generative model of the hippocampal formation trained with theta driven local learning rules
item.description: A model of the hippocampal formation where theta-band oscillations and local error-correcting Hebbian learning rules train weights it analagous to a wake-speel algorithm. This bioplausible hippocampal model replicates key cognitive functions including path integration.

item.title: RatInABox, a toolkit for modelling locomotion and neuronal activity in continuous environments
item.description: This paper documents and motivates the RatInABox package, used for modellign locomotion and neural activity.

item.title: Rapid learning of predictive maps with STDP and theta phase precession
item.description: We study how successor representations can be learned in a biologically plausible way by hippocampal neurons using STDP and theta phase procession.
